title.narrative: AMAZON PLATFORM

description.narrative: By the end of 2016, the States and Municipalities of the Amazon region have committed to reducing child rights and gender and racial related inequities and ensuring CRC compliance to contribute with the improvement of their social indicators for children and adolescents thus addressing inequities in Brazil (Agenda Crianca Amazonia)., which contributes to Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Children In Urban Settings / Local Governance, Corporate External Relations And Partnerships, Communication And Resource Mobilization, Cross-Sectoral Communication For Development, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty, Technical Excellence In Policy And Programmes. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Evaluations, Research And Data, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2016, governments at national and sub-national levels, media, corporate sector and civil society with increased capacities and knowledge on the most disadvantaged children, contributing to the universalization of Child Rights, supporting specific public policies addressing inequities and prioritizing boys and girls in public budgets.

participating-org.narrative: ASSOC VOLUNTARIOS PARA O SERVICO INTERNACIONAL
FUNDACAO PARA O DESENVOLVIMENTO CIENTIFICO E TECNOLOGICO EM SAUDE

sector.narrative: Advocacy and partnership-building for social behaviour change
Child marriage - surveys (e.g. KAP, VACS), data analysis/research/evaluation evidence generation, synthesis, and use
Child poverty analysis towards policy change (Profiling, mapping and identifying drivers of multi-dimensional and monetary poverty of children, modelling and simulation of policy options)
Country programme process (including UNDAF planning and CCA)
Development of multi-sectoral legislation/policies/strategies/action plans supporting development and participation of adolescents
ECD data, evidence, and knowledge generation and dissemination
Social protection and welfare services policy, planning and administration
Social services (incl youth development and women+ children)
Technical assistance - Children in urban settings

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By the end of 2016, the States and Municipalities of the Amazon region have committed to reducing child rights and gender andracial related inequities and ensuring CRC compliance to contribute with the improvement of their social indicators for childrenand adolescents thus addressing inequities in Brazil (Agenda Crianca Amazonia).

description.narrative: More than 3.7 million children and adolescents were benefitted from UNICEF&39;s work in the Amazon region through the UNICEF Seal of Approval, which currently involves 192 municipalities in the nine Amazon states (24 per cent of the total municipalities in the region). | Status:Met | As-of Date:22/12/2016

title.narrative: By the end of 2012, 15% of all municipalities of the Amazon Region being recognized with the UNICEF Municipal Seal of Approval Edition 2009-2012.
By the end of 2012, 40% of all municipalities of Amazon Region participating in all the phases of the UNICEF Seal 2009-2012, including the two forums and the social participation themes
Percentage of municipalities enrolled in the UNICEF Seal of Approval 2013-2016 edition of the Amazon region being awarded with the UNICEF Municipal Seal of Approval.

baseline.value: 23% (based on the results of the first PAM edition of UNICEF Municipal Seal of Approval of 2009-2012 for the Amazon region).

target.value: 2016:By the end of 2016, 20% of the municipalities enrolled in the SEAL 2013-2016 edition of the Amazon region being awarded.

actual.value: 2016:Target achieved: 31% (192/611) of enrolled municipalities awarded with the UNICEF Seal of Approval certificate.

title.narrative: Percentage of the municipalities enrolled in the UNICEF Municipal Seal of Approval 2013-2016 edition of the Amazon Region participating in all the phases of the initiative, including the two forums and the social participation themes.

baseline.value: 34% (based on the results of the first edition of UNICEF Municipal Seal of Approval of 2009-2012 for the Amazon region.)

target.value: 2016:By the end of 2016, 50% of municipalities enrolled in the UNICEF Seal of Approval 2013-2016 edition of the Amazon Region participating in all the phases of the initiative.

actual.value: 2016:Target met. 48% (294/611) of municipalities enrolled in the SEAL have completed the second community forum (the last mandatory step in the methodology) With 40,301 participants, including 1,656 children and 10,492 adolescents from the nine Amazon states.The municipalities that completed all steps

title.narrative: Number of States from the Amazon Region supporting their respective Municipalities initiatives to accomplish the UNICEF Seal goals.

baseline.value: 4 States based on UNICEF Seal Edition 2009-2012.

target.value: 2016:at least six States from the Amazon Region (representing 67% of total States of the Amazon Region

title.narrative: By the end of 2013, 70% of all municipalities of the Amazon Region enrolling in UNICEF Seal, Edition 2013 - 2016

actual.value: 2016:Closed. 76% of the Amazon region enrolled in the UNICEF SEAL of approval.
